DOC.brief_summary: The present study aimed to investigated the effect of Enhanced External Counterpulsation (EECP) on vascular hemodynamics and atherosclerosis, and the underlying shear stress related mechanisms
DOC.brief_title: Impact of Enhanced External Counterpulsation on Vascular Hemodynamics and Status
DOC.detailed_description: Patients with coronary heart disease will be randomized into two groups: standard medical treatment and standard medical treatment plus EECP intervention. Hymodynamic parameters, vascular status and function will be measured.
DOC.criteria: More than 50% stenosis of left main trunk and 3 epicardial coronary arteries and their large branches showed by coronary angiography Or history of myocardial infarction Or history of prior revascularization Signed informed consent to paticipate in the study Clinicallly significant valvular heart disease Aortic aneurysm Congenital heart disease Acute myocarditis Arryhythmias significantly interfere with the triggering of the EECP device History of cerebral hemorrhage Hemorrhagic disease Lower limb infection, phlebitis Deep venous thrombosis Malignant disease INR > 2.5 Uncontrolled hypertention, defined as SBP > 180mmHg or DBP > 110mmHg Pregnancy
